Package de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core

Class CoreElementVBO

java.lang.Object
de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core.CoreElementVBO
public class CoreElementVBO extends Object
Represents an abstraction of a VBO (Vertex Buffer Object) bound as a GL_ELEMENT_BUFFER.

    createAndSendStaticVBO(CoreGL gl, BufferFactory bufferFactory, int[] data)

    static CoreElementVBO

  • Method Details

    • createStaticVBO

      @Nonnull public static CoreElementVBO createStaticVBO(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, @Nonnull int[] data)
      Creates a new VBO with the specified static vertex data (GL_STATIC_DRAW). This will create the vertex buffer object but does not bind or send the vertex data to the GPU. You'll need to call bind() to bind this VBO and you'll need to call send() to transmit the vertex data to the GPU.

    • createAndSendStaticVBO

      @Nonnull public static CoreElementVBO createAndSendStaticVBO(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, @Nonnull int[] data)
      This provides the same functionality as createStaticVBO(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.core.CoreGL, de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.BufferFactory, int[]), but automatically sends the specified vertex data to the GPU.

    • createAndSendStaticVBO

      @Nonnull public static CoreElementVBO createAndSendStaticVBO(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, @Nonnull IntBuffer data)
      This provides the same functionality as createStaticVBO(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.core.CoreGL, de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.BufferFactory, int[]), but automatically sends the specified vertex data to the GPU.

    • createDynamicVBO

      @Nonnull public static CoreElementVBO createDynamicVBO(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, @Nonnull int[] data)
      This works exactly as createStaticVBO(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.core.CoreGL, de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.BufferFactory, int[]), but will use GL_DYNAMIC_DRAW instead.

    • createStreamVBO

      @Nonnull public static CoreElementVBO createStreamVBO(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, @Nonnull int[] data)
      This works exactly as createStaticVBO(de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.core.CoreGL, de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.spi.BufferFactory, int[]), but will use GL_STREAM_DRAW instead.

    • getBuffer

      public IntBuffer getBuffer()
      Allows access to the internal FloatBuffer (stored in system memory, not GPU memory) that contains the original vertex data. You can access and change this buffer if you want to update the buffer content. Just make sure that you call Buffer.rewind() before sending your new vertex data to the GPU with the send() method.

    • bind

      public void bind()
      Binds the VBO as a GL_ELEMENT_BUFFER.

    • unbind

      public void unbind()

    • send

      public void send()
      Sends the current vertex data to the GPU.

    • delete

      public void delete()
      Deletes all vertex data associated with this VBO.

    • enablePrimitiveRestart

      public void enablePrimitiveRestart(int value)
      Enables primitive restart using the specified value.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to use as primitive restart.

    • disablePrimitiveRestart

      public void disablePrimitiveRestart()
      Disables primitive restart.
